title: Forest light computation
text: R package SamsaraLight provides simpler faster way use SamsaraLight ray-tracing model within R environment. SamsaraLight forest radiative transfer model based ray tracing (Courbaud et al., 2003) enables users estimate light intercepted tree light reaches ground virtual light sensors, given forest stand inventory.

title: Check the format and validity of a tree inventory data.frame — check_inventory
text: function performs following checks validations: Ensures tree_inv non-empty data.frame required columns. Checks id_tree values unique. Validates numeric columns (x, y, dbh_cm, h_m, hbase_m, rn_m, rs_m, re_m, rw_m) numeric non-negative. Verifies crown_type values one "E", "P", "2E", "8E", "4P". Ensures crown radii present according crown type. symmetric crowns ("E", "P", "2E"), single effective radius computed four directional radii differ. asymmetric crowns ("8E", "4P"), four directional radii must provided. Checks hmax_m provided required crown type ("2E" "8E") lies hbase_m h_m. Ensures hbase_m < h_m. Verifies tree least one crown interception property defined (crown_openness crown_lad). Provides informative error messages warnings invalid conditions.

title: Create a rectangular virtual stand from a tree inventory — create_sl_stand
text: trees_inv data.frame one row per tree. See check_inventory required structure validated columns. cell_size Numeric. Side length square cells composing stand (meters). slope Numeric. Slope plot (degrees). aspect Numeric. Aspect slope, defined azimuth downslope direction, clockwise North (degrees). North = 0, East = 90, South = 180, West = 270. north2x Numeric. Clockwise angle North X-axis (degrees). value 0 corresponds Y-axis oriented toward North. sensors Optional data.frame defining position height sensor within stand. title: Create a rectangular virtual stand from a tree inventory — create_sl_stand
text: named list following elements: trees Data.frame final tree inventory, including added trees fill_around = TRUE. structure matches inventory format validated check_inventory, additional derived variables required ray tracing. logical column added_to_fill indicates whether tree originates initial inventory added fill around inventory zone. core_polygon List describing inventory zone: df: data.frame polygon vertices sf: corresponding sf POLYGON use_rect_zone: logical flag transform List transformation filling information, including core area, target final basal area, number added trees, applied spatial shifts. geometry List describing stand geometry terrain parameters (cell size, number cells, slope, aspect, orientation).

title: Create a rectangular virtual stand from a tree inventory — create_sl_stand
text: function supports sloping terrain coordinate system rotation, returns fully prepared stand ready use ray-tracing pipeline (see run_sl). returned trees data.frame conforms inventory format checked check_inventory, following controlled modifications: Tree vertical position z computed terrain slope aspect. Crown maximum radius height hmax_m computed fixed crown geometry conventions: "P" "4P": hmax_m = hbase_m "E" "4E": hmax_m = hbase_m + 0.5 * (h_m - hbase_m) crown types "2E" "8E", hmax_m must provided user. missing, column dbh_cm added filled NA. missing, crown interception properties (e.g. crown_openness, crown_lad) added using default values. function ensures trees fall within core inventory polygon, applying small buffers necessary handle numerical precision issues. Invalid polygons automatically repaired possible. fill_around = TRUE, trees randomly sampled original inventory positioned outside core polygon target basal area per hectare reached full rectangular stand.

title: Create a rectangular virtual stand from a tree inventory — create_sl_stand
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data_prenovel <- SamsaRaLight::data_prenovel trees_inv <- data_prenovel$trees  stand <- create_sl_stand(   trees_inv = trees_inv,   cell_size = 5,   slope = 10,   aspect = 180,   north2x = 0,   use_rect_zone = TRUE,   fill_around = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )  head(stand$trees) } # }

title: Run SamsaRaLight radiative balance — run_sl
text: sl_stand object class "sl_stand" describing forest stand, created create_sl_stand. contains trees, sensors, terrain, grid geometry. monthly_radiations data.frame monthly horizontal radiation (Hrad, MJ m\(^{-2}\)) diffuse--global ratio (DGratio), typically obtained using get_monthly_radiations checked using check_monthly_radiations.. latitude Numeric. Latitude stand (degrees). sensors_only Logical. TRUE, compute light interception sensors (much faster). use_torus Logical. TRUE, stand borders treated using torus (periodic) geometry, mimicking infinite forest, representative virtual stand. FALSE, borders open (surrounded grassland). turbid_medium Logical. TRUE, tree crowns treated turbid medium (Beer–Lambert law using crown_lad). FALSE, crowns treated porous envelopes (using crown_openness). detailed_output Logical. TRUE, output contains detailed diffuse/direct energies light datasets, full interception matrices interceptions output ray discretization monthy_rays. FALSE, total energies returned (recommended uses).

title: Run SamsaRaLight radiative balance — run_sl

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data_prenovel <- SamsaRaLight::data_prenovel  stand <- create_sl_stand(   trees = data_prenovel$trees,   sensors = data_prenovel$sensors,   cell_size = 5,   slope = 10,   aspect = 180,   north2x = 0 )  rad <- get_monthly_radiations(45.8, 3.1)  out <- run_sl(   sl_stand = stand,   monthly_radiations = rad,   latitude = 45.8 )  out$light$trees } # }
